intro: Galenia portulacacea, commonly known as the sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent foliage and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are fleshy and often covered in a fine layer of white powder, which helps reduce water loss. Galenia portulacacea produces small, star-shaped flowers that are usually pink or purple, blooming in spring and summer.
